latex: In the Euclidean three-dimensional space, we call \textit{folding} of a sphere $S$ every partition of $S \setminus \{x,y\}$ into disjoint circles, where $x$ and $y$ are two points of $S$. A folding of $S$ is called \textbf{linear} if the circles of the \textit{folding} are obtained by the intersection of $S$ with a family of parallel planes or with a family of planes containing a straight line $D$ exterior to $S$. Is every \textit{folding} of a sphere $S$ \textbf{linear}?
